name: snopsuppss
params: class c0, class c1, class c2

stmt.origin: sstri(co(csn(cop(c0, c1)), csupp, c2), csn(c0), cdm(csn(cop(c0, c1))))

body.origin:
|- wss(co(csn(cop(c0, c1)), csupp, c2), csn(c0))
-| wss(co(csn(cop(c0, c1)), csupp, c2), cdm(csn(cop(c0, c1))))
-| wss(cdm(csn(cop(c0, c1))), csn(c0))

cumulated.origin:
|- wss(co(csn(cop(c0, c1)), csupp, c2), csn(c0))
-| wss(co(csn(cop(c0, c1)), csupp, c2), cdm(csn(cop(c0, c1))))
-| wss(cdm(csn(cop(c0, c1))), csn(c0))

body.origin: |- wss(co(csn(cop(c0, c1)), csupp, c2), cdm(csn(cop(c0, c1))))

cumulated.origin:
|- wss(co(csn(cop(c0, c1)), csupp, c2), csn(c0))
-| wss(cdm(csn(cop(c0, c1))), csn(c0))

comment: The support of a singleton containing an ordered pair is a subset of the singleton containing the first element of the ordered pair, i.e. it is empty or the singleton itself. (Contributed by AV, 19-Jul-2019.)
